html: As Israel sang a Song of Salvation when Jehovah delivered his people from bondage in Egypt, so do those whom he delivers in the end-time—“Then sang Moses and the people of Israel this song to Jehovah and said, ‘I will sing to Jehovah, for he hath triumphed gloriously. Horse and rider he has thrown into the sea. Jehovah is my strength and song. He has become my salvation’” (Exodus 15:1-2). Whereas Moses led Jehovah’s people out of Egypt, the servant leads them from the end of the earth, the isles of the sea, the desert and its towns, and the tops of the mountains (Isaiah 49:8-13; 60:3-9).
